official-title.#text: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to treat certain population census tracts for which information is not available as low-income communities for purposes of the new markets tax credit.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text: Certain population census tracts for which information is not available made eligible for new markets tax credit

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

header.#text: Special rule for tracts for which information is not available

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines there is insufficient information to determine whether such tract is a low-income community (determined without regard to this paragraph), such tract shall be treated as a low-income community if—

text.#text: In the case of a population census tract with respect to which the
such tract is adjacent to two or more low-income communities (determined without regard to this paragraph), and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: does not have information indicating that such tract is not a low-income community (as so determined).

text.#text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to investments made after the date of the enactment of this Act.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 3809 IH: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to treat certain population census tracts for which information is not available as low-income communities for purposes of the new markets tax credit.
